sn35.145:1.2: The cause and condition that gives rise to sights is also not-self.
sn35.145:1.3: Since sights are produced by what is not-self, how could they be self?
sn35.145:1.9: The cause and condition that gives rise to thoughts is also not-self.
sn35.145:1.10: Since thoughts are produced by what is not-self, how could they be self?
sn35.145:1.12: Being disillusioned, desire fades away. When desire fades away they’re freed. When they’re freed, they know they’re freed.
sn35.145:1.13: They understand: ‘Rebirth is ended, the spiritual journey has been completed, what had to be done has been done, there is no return to any state of existence.’”
